skill.name: Documentation & Knowledge Standards
skill.description: Best practices for self-documenting code, API schemas, and README files.
skill.content:
# Professional Documentation Standards
## Self-Documenting Code - **Intent-based Naming**: Variable and function names should explain *what* they do. - **Small Functions**: Break complex logic into small, named units that read like prose. - **Avoid Obvious Comments**: Don't comment code that is already clear. Use comments to explain the "Why" (business logic, workarounds), not the "How".
## API & Technical Docs - **OpenAPI/Swagger**: Always define external API schemas using standard specs. - **Docstrings**: Use standard formats (Google, JSDoc, Sphinx) for public-facing libraries. - **Type Hints**: Use TypeScript or Python Type Hints to make code behavior predictable without reading docs.
## README Standards 1. **The Hook**: Clear title and one-sentence value proposition. 2. **Prerequisites**: Exact versions of runtimes/tools needed. 3. **Quick Start**: Minimal steps to get the project running. 4. **Architecture**: High-level overview of how components interact.
